definition: human nature (idiom)/a behavior that is only natural
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
always/ever/often/frequently/common/general/constant
surname Chang
feeling/emotion/passion/situation

sentences.english: To err is human. To forgive, divine.
Nothing is more human than fearing the outsider.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼比害怕侵略者更是人之常情了。

sentences.english: To lose is human, to win is divine, to draw is an art.
sentences.chinese: 輸是人之常情，贏是神的境界，逼和是藝術。

sentences.english: Poor parental love, the parents Succeed is also a human.
sentences.chinese: 可憐天下父母心，家長們望子成龍也是人之常情。

sentences.english: To err is human, to forgive is divine.
sentences.chinese: 犯錯乃人之常情，寬恕則超凡入聖也。

sentences.english: It is simply natural that anyone would feel sad with such kind of things happening. No one could be any exception.
sentences.chinese: 這是人之常情，發生這樣的事情，誰都會難過的。

sentences.english: DIVINE】To err is human. To forgive is divine.
sentences.chinese: 犯錯是人之常情，寬恕是超凡的。

sentences.english: TO ERR is human, but to foul things up completely takes a computer, or so the old saw goes.
sentences.chinese: 犯錯是人之常情，但做錯事的電腦卻總是難逃罪責。

definition: common sense/the way people usually feel about things
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
pardonable (of interruption, misunderstanding etc)
lit. heaven's law and earth's principle (idiom); fig. right and proper/right and unalterable/a matter of course
lit. seek but fail to get (idiom); fig. exactly what one’s been looking for
to mind/to brood over/to be concerned about
need not/unnecessary
hard to avoid/difficult to escape from/will inevitably
(rhetorical question) when?/how?/it's not that...
to put oneself in sb else's shoes (idiom)
nobody is perfect/everyone has their defect
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
to force someone to do something
selfishness/selfish motives
(literary) to make it so/to dictate
